div.p: Description: A Drug Identification Number (DIN) is a number assigned by Health Canada to a drug product prior to being marketed in Canada. It consists of eight digits (numbers) generated by a computer system in the Submission and Information Policy Division. http://www.hc-sc.gc.ca/dhp-mps/prodpharma/databasdon/index_e.html

description.value: Description: A Drug Identification Number (DIN) is a number assigned by Health Canada to a drug product prior to being marketed in Canada.
